purpleculture_pinyin:
chán
to wind around; to wrap round; to coil; tangle; to involve; to bother; to annoy
наматывать; обернуть; наматывать; клубок; включать; беспокоить; раздражать
rtega_mnemonic:
纏纏RS
缠缠		wrap, wind around, tie, bind
  • bind produce in the shop 廛 with a cord 糸 to sell them
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 缠)
Pictophonetic: 廛 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
纏繞 [ chán rào ]: twisting; to twine; to wind; to pester; to bother
纏綿 [ chán mián ]: touching (emotions); lingering (illness)
纏身 [ chán shēn ]: (of an illness, debt etc) to plague sb; to preoccupy sb; difficult to get rid of
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 廛 [ chán ] store, shop
heisig_chinese_memo: Spidey needs to turn off a computer in a cave (countdown clock for nuclear bomb). However, his human legs get stuck in the soil (some kind of quicksand). The situation seems hopeless... but Spidey just wind around a metal pole with his web and pulls himself out. After than he saves the day somehow.
Ru_Meaning: wear, wrap, tie, follow around, collect
Ru_Radicals: 儿 (ножки), 土 (земля), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 广 (скала с точкой), 糸 (нить), 里 (родная деревня)
Ru_trainchinese: chán: (глаг) обматывать, опутывать, обвивать; надоедать; иметь дело с
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the threads (糸) from the shop (廛) are what you put on
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Instead of mounting it on the wall of my cave I rather used some thread to wind around my computer and then hung it on the ceiling.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "糸", "廛", the original meaning is coiled. "Shuowen": "Ruoye. Congshi, 廛声." Hanban Gu (Xidu Fu): "Squalls are entangled with each other."

" Wrapped " can mean rope. "Huainanzi-Dao Yingxun": "The ministers have and the payers are entangled in the nine parties." Gao Yinan's note: "Tangle, seek."

" Entangling " also means entanglement and disturbance. "The Book of the Later Han-Ban Gu Chuan 2": "Han Xing has come, and the past years have been conquered by soldiers, especially the Huns."

" Zang " is also a Buddhist word, which means trouble. "Mahayana Righteous Chapter" Volume 5: "Those who are said to be impaired have different meanings, but there are many kinds. It may be called trouble... or Zang."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of "糸" and "廛", the original meaning is coiled.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「廛」聲，本義為盤繞。《說文》：「繞也。从糸，廛聲。」 漢班固〈西都賦〉：「颮颮紛紛，矰繳相纏。」

　　「纏」可表示繩索。《淮南子‧道應訓》：「臣有所與供儋纏采薪者九方堙。」高誘注：「纏，索也。」

　　「纏」還表示糾纏、攪擾。《後漢書‧班固傳下》：「漢興已來，曠世歷年，兵纏夷狄，尤事匈奴。」

　　「纏」亦是佛教語，表示煩惱。《大乘義章》卷五：「所言障者，隨義不同，乃有多種。或名煩惱……或名為纏。」

The situation seems hopeless... but Spidey just wind around a metal pole with his web and pulls himself out. After than he saves the day somehow.

從「 糸 」，「 廛 」聲，本義為盤繞。《說文》：「繞也。从糸，廛聲。」 漢班固〈西都賦〉：「颮颮紛紛，矰繳相纏。」 「 纏 」可表示繩索。《淮南子‧道應訓》：「臣有所與供儋纏采薪者九方堙。」高誘注：「纏，索也。」 「 纏 」還表示糾纏、攪擾。《後漢書‧班固傳下》：「漢興已來，曠世歷年，兵纏夷狄，尤事匈奴。」 「 纏 」亦是佛教語，表示煩惱。《大乘義章》卷五：「所言障者，隨義不同，乃有多種。或名煩惱……或名為纏。」
From the sound of " 糸", " 廛", the original meaning is coiled. "Shuowen": "Ruoye. Congshi, 廛声." Hanban Gu (Xidu Fu): "Squalls are entangled with each other." " Wrapped" can mean rope. "Huainanzi-Dao Yingxun": "The ministers have and the payers are entangled in the nine parties." Gao Yinan's note: "Tangle, seek." " Entangling" also means entanglement and disturbance. "The Book of the Later Han-Ban Gu Chuan 2": "Han Xing has come, and the past years have been conquered by soldiers, especially the Huns." " Zang" is also a Buddhist word, which means trouble. "Mahayana Righteous Chapter" Volume 5: "Those who are said to be impaired have different meanings, but there are many kinds. It may be called trouble... or Zang."

纏字的基本解释

纏
chán
见“缠”。

纏字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chán］
［《廣韻》直連切，平仙，澄。］
［《廣韻》持碾切，去線，澄。］
“缠1”的繁体字。亦作“緾1”。亦作“繵2”。亦作“纒1”。
(1)盘绕；扎束。
(2)绳索。
(3)纠缠；搅扰。
(4)招惹；应付。
(5)通“躔”。践历。
(6)佛教语。烦恼之异名。
(7)姓。

纏字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　纏； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页943第03
【廣韻】直連切【集韻】【韻會】澄延切，?音廛。【說文】繞也。【玉篇】約也。【廣韻】束也。【詩·唐風·綢繆束薪傳】綢繆，纏綿也。　又姓。【廣韻】漢有纏子著書。　又【廣韻】特碾切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】直碾切，?廛去聲。義同。　【集韻】或作繵。【類篇】或省作緾。

【五經文字】纏，俗作纏。纏原字从?。
纏字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

纏字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chán］
["Guangyun" is cut straight, flat and clear. ]
["Guangyun" is grinding and cutting, removing the thread, and clearing. ]
The traditional characters of "Tang 1". Also known as "緾1". Also known as "繵2". Also known as "纒1".
(1) Coiled; tied.
(2) Rope.
(3) Entanglement; disturbance.
(4) To provoke; to deal with.
(5) Through "Lin". Practice experience.
(6) Buddhist language. Synonyms for troubles.
(7) Last name.
